comments:
The error message is "Specify a valid XML Schema and try loading again". 

Steps are:
1. File | New | EMF Models, Next
2. Pick your project, Next
3. "Load from schema", Next
4. Enter path to a XSD file. E.g. enter "D:/xerces-2_6_2/data/personal.xsd" as 
an input schema (the file comes with workaround for Xerces)

Perhaps you didn't apply the workaround correctly.  Please provide both a stack 
trace from the workspace/.metadata/.log and the schema that caused the problem.

Barys,

I had to find the personal.xsd myself; attaching it to the defect is not too 
much to ask, I think. I was able to load this sample without a problem and to 
generate the Java code for it, so I can't reproduce the problem.

Also, the stack trace you show below is produced when you are generating some 
model, so it is not related to this defect at all which involves importing a 
model in the first place.  Please remove your .log, reproduce the scenario, and 
look at the contents of the .log after that, so you can be sure that the trace 
you send me is related to the problem.

Created an attachment (id=10557)
another log file from metadata.

Ed,

The reason I did not include personal.xsd because when you submit a defect in 
bugzilla there is no way to do it for a new bug. However it is possible once 
the defect is submitted.

Please find the latest .log file attached.

The workaround was not applied correctly. The command line arguments that I 
used contained extra '.' symbol. After removing the import from XSD started to 
work correctly. Ed Merks helped me to investigate the issue.
